  "description": "White Soul Group is a leading provider of logistics solutions and vehicle sales and after-sales services, dedicated to delivering excellence in every aspect of our business. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recovery Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Cross River and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a skilled and proactive Recovery Officer to join our operations team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for the recovery and rescue of vehicles, providing first response assistance in the event of breakdowns, accidents, or road emergencies.
	This role requires a hands-on individual with strong mechanical awareness, driving competence, and safety consciousness.


Responsibilities


	Respond promptly to vehicle breakdowns, accidents, or other roadside emergencies.
	Recover, tow, or coordinate the safe transport of vehicles back to designated locations.
	Perform basic on-site troubleshooting and provide first-level mechanical or electrical assistance.
	Administer first aid to drivers or passengers when necessary and ensure proper escalation for medical emergencies.
	Maintain recovery tools, equipment, and vehicles in excellent working condition.
	Keep accurate records of recovery operations and incident reports.
	Collaborate with the fleet, workshop, and safety teams to ensure efficient rescue operations.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND qualification
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in vehicle recovery, towing, or related operations.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license (Class E or higher) and excellent driving skills.
	First Aid certification or proven first responder training is required.
	Strong mechanical aptitude and understanding of truck operations.
	Ability to work under pressure, especially during emergency situations.
	Excellent communication, reporting, and teamwork skills.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@whitesoulgroup.org&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.",

Finance Business Partner Job at Smile Communications




        
    

        
        Smile Communications provides 4G LTE mobile broadband in several countries in Africa. Our objective is to become the broadband provider of choice for Superfast mobile broadband internet and Super Clear voice services in each of our markets and to provide over 300 million potential customers in our countries of operation with a fast, reliable and high-quality broadband internet to accelerate development and wealth creation.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our mission is a fully connected Africa enabled by a team that is driven by passion, integrity, humility and humanity. Smile is a diverse, equal opportunities organisation and is committed to developing talent in the telecommunications industry in all of the countries it operates in. In addition to considering your skills and competencies, your fit with our culture and values is important.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Business Partner

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Role Description


	The Finance Business Partner will assist in financial planning, business planning, and financial reporting, and perform analysis to offer insights and recommendations that drive business decisions.
	The role involves preparing financial metrics, analyzing trends, and collaborating with various departments to ensure accurate financial forecasting and budgeting.


Responsibilities


	Maintain a tracker of actual CAPEX in comparison to the approved budget/forecast and report tomanagement on variance
	Review and update budget information on motivations for OPEX received from user departments
	Review and validate invoices created on the system for assigned vendors
	Prepare Vendor reconciliation statements for review by the finance manager
	Prepare payment packs for assigned vendors for approval by the finance manager
	Provide required input to the financial planning team with regards to the preparation of site profitability reports.
	Review and maintain assigned expense ledgers for validity and completeness of entries
	Participate in preparation of budget/forecast for relevant departments
	 Perform month end account closing activities as may be assigned by the finance manager
	Ensure compliance with and propose appropriate updates to approved policies, processes and procedures
	Prepare GL schedules and analysis for audit purposes
	Perform other duties which may be assigned from time to time by the finance manager or other competent official.
	Perform other ad hoc roles as may be assigned by the Chief Finance Officer or other authorized personnel


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting / Finance / Business Administration / Any other Science related Discipline with a minimum of 4 years’ experience
	Masters degree is an added advantage
	ICAN/ACCA certification is compulsory
	Proficient in financial reporting and finance management
	Strong financial planning and business planning skills
	Proficient in financial reporting and finance management
	Excellent analytical skills for assessing financial data and trends
	Relevant experience in the finance industry
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
